content:
Hello
I got this message :


Le jeu a cessé de fonctionner. Veuillez contacter l'auteur(e) et transmettre l'erreur suivante :

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.codingame.gameengine.module.entities.WorldState.flushEntityState(WorldState.java:59)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.module.entities.GraphicEntityModule.lambda$flushAllEntityStates$0(GraphicEntityModule.java:169)
	at java.util.Spliterators$ArraySpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:948)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$Head.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:580)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.module.entities.GraphicEntityModule.flushAllEntityStates(GraphicEntityModule.java:169)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.module.entities.GraphicEntityModule.commitState(GraphicEntityModule.java:164)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.module.entities.GraphicEntityModule.commitEntityState(GraphicEntityModule.java:146)
	at com.codingame.game.gui.Interface.acquireBonusBegin(Interface.kt:113)
	at com.codingame.game.gui.Animator.animateGameState$lambda$14(Animator.kt:98)
	at com.codingame.game.gui.Animator.run(Animator.kt:23)
	at com.codingame.game.gui.Animator.animateGameState(Animator.kt:117)
	at com.codingame.game.Referee.gameTurn(Referee.kt:180)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.start(GameManager.java:122)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.start(RefereeMain.java:67)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.main(RefereeMain.java:50)

For once I won!!!
Fixed some visual glitches :)

I think the mechanics are broken.  https://www.codingame.com/replay/672468116 'You receive 1 Button per Timepoint your time token moves.'  not so much.  The more efficient I make the income and patch fitting the worse I do on win/loss.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'ai codé une solution pour chaque league en m'aidant du code du referee. A certaines phases, j'ai eu un peu de mal à comprendre certaines règles (visuel un peu confus parfois)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good game. Many leagues & Many boss to try to beat !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I loved it. Both the mechanics and the esthetics. I have tried all leagues, and in all of them I have not found any problems.
cool

Contribution is now ready for your approval.

(Pushed statement through AI to fix my grammar + another small refactor so that source code is more readable for those of you interested in it)

Hello VizGhar,
I made a bot up to the highest level : only brute-force + evaluation @ depth 1.
No problem with the rules.
The branching factor is huge. Pruning will be required to go deep with min-max ! Next steps : simulate moves and min-max with pruning.
You made a great job thru this "multi" proposal. Thanks.

Hello VizGhar,
Some shape have a length of 17 char (..O..|OOOOO|..O..) and in the stub "int patchShape:word(15)" drive to an overflow of the array (in particular in C).
The idea of the game is cool. I will try to make a bot ASAP and will give you a feedback.

Version 1.0 - beta3 is out!
- added list of most recent opponent moves to STUB (usable by advanced players)
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
cool stuff ! I'm in a hurry to clash to this code!

Version 1.0 - beta2 is out!
- visual bugfix for 1st league - income animation during skip removed
- added 1 more league to bridge huge gap between 1st and 2nd league
- proceeding to higher league will now not result in insta loses because of insufficient funds etc.

Version 1.0 - beta1 is out!
- visual bugfix mentioned by @barbora where focusing one tile enlarged incorrect one
- visual bugix where special patch was not animated when placed using SKIP
- bosses rewritten in Java. Compiles faster; more players are able to read code
- brutaltester compatibility incorporated and mentioned in statements
- wording of statements updated

If there is anybody willing to help me with starter codes I'd be grateful... You will be added to honorable mentions at the end of statement.
The patch zoom sometimes doesn't work correctly. For example https://www.codingame.com/replay/662625720 from frame 27 - the first patches don't zoom.

No further changes to game are planned. Now it depends on you guys :)

Release notes
- Fixed small bugs (assassination of first move resulted in draw, one tile had missing buttons etc.)
- Added debug options
- Animations complete
- 4th Boss improved. No other changes to bosses will be made
- 1st league is now shorter - the game previously ended in too many skips
- stub changed - now you will receive all remaining patches every round, check statement

The implementation of this game was quite difficult.
Maybe that's why it's hard for people to get together.
I think it's a very good game.

The actual default code and the line of explanation are different.
I think it's good to match the description with the current default code.

Boss1 is too strong.It seems that there are not many people who break through in the current situation. My program can beat Boss3, but the version without rotation and flipping cannot beat Boss1.

League 4 may still be in the works, but the default code is giving errors

The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Only leagues 1-3 supported
	at com.codingame.game.LeagueConfigKt.leagueInit(LeagueConfig.kt:79)

Default program is not working.
in Python3

Standard Error Stream:
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: '5 11 17 23 29 35 41 47 53'
at Answer.py. in <module> on line 9

I hope it will be interesting.
Fixed :) Thank you

All fixed now
The biggest problem for me is to keep track of proper stub :) no automation in there

very well documented repository (and guidances to start, and detailed instruction for the use of brutal tester as well :-))! I'l try to make a starter code in Python as the implementation takes a little more difficult than the other contributions I have tested. Happy Sunday! :-)
Fixed. I'll be waiting for yur feedback, thanks

Thank you trictrac. Contribution is now open for approval.

Now it's my turn to make good bot too. I'll try the MCTS but it might take a month or two
Thank you very much! Now get ready to reapprove :D
Thank you :)

Default bot covered more squares you did, skipped less turns and you both haven't received Bonus button. He gained a lot of traction playing his first 2 moves. Also it looks like you are not anticipating opponent turns at all. By move 15 you have covered 15 squares and you opponent 33. Bot's score at this point is +36 for covering quilt board and -21points for buttons received at earning phase.

The SKIP move should be considered "bad" move by default. Otherwise game would end up in both players skipping too often

Try to pick "anything" from beginning and cover 7x7 square first. The 7x7 forces players to cover area with not-so-good tiles

Thanks for report. Fixed

This happened because my code wasn't expecting somebody to acquire bonus (fill 7x7 area) in lower than final league.
So this bug was affecting only lower leagues and therefore I've missed it

Have fun

I made one starter bot here in Python (just a slight retranscription of your Boss1.java). I can shorten if needed. https://pastebin.com/xn0TZe8T

I have just fixed my starter's bot and reduced it a little to suppress my debug features. I always mix x and y with 2d arrays between Java and Python (same with euler's puzzles)

Note: feel free to modify my heuristic method : it was not my best one :-D
Hope I understand. I will test it and let you know.
Just tried it and error message popped up in player (in timeline where controls are). Can you send me replay?

Ah I just found message "philRG unknown command" in the timeline at 1st turn. So this should be enough imho even for beginners to investigate. Sorry for the imprecise reporting :-) https://www.codingame.com/share-replay/665311134

I have implemented bots for level 1 & 2 (no major bug encountered), I did not handle special patch's action on level 4-5 (did not have time to read the new rules).

Great work! :-)
